items.title: Annual valorization
items.body: Every 1 June ZUS valorizes the balance recorded as of 31 January with the index for the previous year.

items.title: Quarterly valorization
items.body: If retirement begins after 31 January, an additional quarterly valorization is applied, accounting for economic growth since the last valorization.

items.title: Initial capital
items.body: Initial capital is the valorized value of contributions and work history before 1999. The first valorization index was 115.60% (1999).

items.title: Life expectancy table (SDŻ)
items.body: Pension amount is calculated by dividing the capital by the expected remaining life (in months). Life expectancy tables are published annually by GUS.

items.title: Pension contribution
items.body: The pension insurance contribution is 19.52% of the assessment base. For employment contracts (UoP), the base is the full gross salary.

items.title: UoP vs JDG - contribution differences
items.body: Employment contract (UoP): contributions calculated from full gross salary. Self-employment (JDG): option to pay contributions from a lower base.

items.title: Flat rate in JDG
items.body: Entrepreneurs taxed with a flat rate can pay ZUS contributions from a reduced base (30% of income or max 4500 PLN). This means lower contributions but also lower future pension.

items.title: Career periods
items.body: For more accurate results, consider different career periods: contract changes, breaks, promotions. Each period with a different contract type or salary affects the final pension capital.

items.title: Replacement rate
items.body: The replacement rate is the ratio of pension amount to last salary (in %). In Poland it averages 50-60%, but depends on career length, salary level and contract types.

items.title: Retirement quarter
items.body: The timing of retirement (quarter) affects quarterly valorization. The later in the year, the higher the additional valorization.
